THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY OF BELLEVILLE

BY-LAW NUMBER 14187

A BY-LAW TO PROVIDE FOR ESTABLISHING, MAINTAINING AND REGULATING A

PUBLIC MARKET PLACE ON THE MARKET SQUARE IN THE CITY OF
BELLEVILLE ; .

THE COUNCIL OF THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY OF BELLEVILLE ENACTS AS
FOLLOWS:

Location

4. The public Market place for the City of Belleville shall consist of the
following areas, which are hereinafter referred to as the Market Square:

(a) McAnnany Street extending east from the front of the

City Hall building to the west boundary of Pinnacle
Street;

(b) Market Street extending east from the front of the City

Hall building to the west boundary of Pinnacle Street,
and;

(c) The interior of the Square lying east of the City Hall
building;

all of which are set out on a plan attached hereto as SCHEDULE "A".

Definitions

2. In this By-Law:

(a) “person” means an_ individual, sole proprietorship, partnership,
unincorporated association, trust, or a body corporate.

(b) "farm" means:
(i) land, whether adjoining or not, operated as a farm, or;

(ii) a production facility or facilities for the production or manufacture of
produce, livestock or handicrafts;

any of which are owned or operated by the same person.

(c) “vendor” means a person who holds a lease to occupy Market vendor
space at the Farmers' Market.

Market Clerk
3. A Market Clerk shall be appointed by the Chief Administrative Officer to
administer the Farmers’ Market, to collect the annual lease payments and daily
rentals and pay the same to the City Treasurer. Duties of the Market Clerk shall

be set out in a Post Description, which may be amended from time to time, in
accordance with established City procedures.

BY-LAW NUMBER 14187 -2-

The Market Clerk shall be under the supervision and control of the City
Clerk, which Department may designate any person to assist the Market Clerk or
to discharge the duties of that office in the absence of the Market Clerk. Said
person shall perform all the duties and have all the power and authority vested

in the Market Clerk, as set out in this By-Law or any other regulations affecting
the operation of the Market Square.

Products

f
4. Sales on the Market Square shall be confined to produce, including fruits
and vegetables, livestock, and handicrafts that are grown, raised, processed,
Manufactured or devised in Ontario.

The dispensing and sale of cooked and/or processed food products from
a handeart or other form of conveyance shall not be permitted on the Market
Square, unless approved by City Council.

The sale of handicrafts shall only be permitted by the person(s) who
made such handicratts, or the agent thereof.

Sale of citrus fruits, bananas and/or fruits and vegetables grown outside
Ontario shall not be permitted on the Market Square.

Produce and livestock must be approved by the Market Clerk.

Produce may include home baked goods, meats, fish, dressed poultry,
butter, eggs, honey, mapie syrup, apple cider, sweets, fruit, vegetables,
preserves, home-baked cooking products, salads, flowers, plants, trees, shrubs,
Christmas trees, firewood and ail other products from the farm, garden or dairy.

Livestock shall include only common domestic pet animals such as dogs
and cats, subject to Provincia! and Municipal health regulations.

Handicrafts may include jewellery, hand-thrown ceramics, loom and
needle products, wood and iron products, paintings, sculpture, and all other
similar products that are hand-made rather than mass produced.

Second hand goods shall not be permitted to be sold on the Market.

Subject to Section 4, only goods will be permitted for sale which are
approved by the Market Clerk.

In addition to the restrictions in Section 4, the Market Clerk will only
permit the sate of handicrafts which are approved in consultation with the Quinte
Arts Council, the Farmer's Market Association and the Board of Management
Belleville Business improvement Area, and which are made in Ontario.

Hours of Operation

6. Market days shall be Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday of each week from
6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., local time.

Tenancy

7.

A Market vendor space shall be a maximum of 2.75 metres in width and
6.0 metres in length.

BY-LAW NUMBER 14187 -3-

18.

The rate structure for leasing a Market vendor space shall be as follows:

vendor space annual rental $126.00 .
daily rental! $ 25.00 to a maximum
of $150.00

Subject to the terms of this By-Law, a person shall be permitted to lease
or rent a maximum of three (3) Market vendor spaces.

A vendor, or a person who applies to become a vendor, must be a
member, in good standing, of the Farmers' Market Association.

A vendor must reside within, or operate and maintain a farm within a
60 mile radius of the City of Belleville.

Notwithstanding Section 11, any vendor located outside the radius

described in Section 11 who held a lease as of December 31, 1995, may
continue to renew that lease.

Any vendor described in Section 12 may only sell at the Farmers’ Market
the type of produce the vendor sold prior to January 1, 1996.

The Market Clerk shall not enter into a lease agreement with more than
one person from any farm.

The regulations concerning leasing of Market spaces shail be as set forth
in SCHEDULE “B" to this By-Law.

A person wishing to become a vendor on an annual basis shall, on or
before the last day in November in each year, submit an application ta the
Market Clerk, including the rental fee prescribed therefor. Upon such application
the Market Clerk, in consultation with the Farmers’ Market Association, may
allocate space to the applicant person, if the applicant person satisfies the terms
of this By-Law. Upon the execution of the prescribed lease agreement, the
applicant person shall be a vendor and shall be entitled to the space so
allocated on Market days fram the first Saturday in January to the last Saturday
in December. Application forms may be obtained from the Market Clerk.

On and after the first Sunday in December in each year any space on the
Market Square, which has not been allocated on an annual basis, shall be made
available for daily rental on Market days. Upon submission of an application
and the payment of the prescribed daily rental fee, the Market Clerk, in
consultation with the Farmers’ Market Association, shall allocate the same
amount of space as in the case of annual allocations.

A Market vendor space nat occupied by the vendor to whom it is leased

by 9:00 a.m. shall become available for daily rental by the Market Clerk after
9:00 a.m.

BY-LAW NUMBER 14187 -4-

19.

A Market space not occupied by 9:00 a.m. may revert to its use as public
parking space.

Operation

20.

21.

22.

23.

24.

Vendors shall place their vehicles in accordance with the directions of the
Market Clerk and shall keep their leased space in a clean and orderly state
during occupation of same and upon leaving shall remove all refuse and litter
therefrom. Waste containers on the Market Square are for the use of the
general public and should not be used by vendors. Vendors occupying the
interior of the Square shall take all reasonable precautions to prevent motor
vehicle lubricants and fluids from teaking onto the Square.

No vendor shall operate their business in a noisy or disruptive manner or
interrupt the general business of the Market Square, or obstruct the same or the
persons attending it.

No vendor shail prevent or monopolize the sale of grain, wood, meat, fish,
vegetables, poultry, dairy products, eggs or any other articles for home
consumption that are sold on the Market Square.

The sale of domestic pet animals such as dogs and cats on the Market

Square is authorized only, if such animals are in a cage or container approved
by the Market Clerk.

The storing and display of perishables and livestock shall be in
accordance with all applicable Provincial and Municipal regulations.

By-Law Status

25.

26.

27.

28.

29.

No person shall sell or offer for sale anything at the Farmers’ Market

except in accordance with the provisions of this By-Law and after the execution
of a lease pursuant to Section 15.

Market vendors may use the electricity supply on the Market Square for
purposes incidental to vending with the approval of the Market Clerk only, and

shall not use the electricity supply for the purpose of heating the vendor space
or the vendor's motor vehicle and/or trailer.

No person shall occupy Market vendor spaces which he or she is not
entitled to occupy under his or her lease.

No person shall sell produce other than produce permitted under the
provisions of this By-Law.

No person shail sell produce if he or she ceases to be a Member, in good
standing, of the Farmers’ Market Association.

BY-LAW NUMBER 14187 -§-

30.

By-Law Number 14152 and ail other By-Laws or part of By-Laws
inconsistent herewith, are hereby rescinded.

Contravention

31.

Every person who contravenes any of the provisions of this By-Law shall
be guilty of an offence and liable upon conviction to the penaities provided in the
Provincial Offences Act or any successor legislation and, in addition, if after
receiving notice, in writing, from the Market Clerk, or designate, as established
in this By-Law, requiring that person to remedy the violation, such person does
not do so, such person shall be subject to summary removal from the Market, as
directed by the said Market Clerk, or designate, together with such vehicles,
goods, provisions and other articles which occupy space in the Market Square
and which are, or have been, in the possession of that person.

THIS BY-LAW SHALL COME INTO FORCE AND TAKE EFFECT IMMEDIATELY ON
AND AFTER THE PASSING THEREOF.

THE LESSEE AGREES THAT:

1. The City reserves the right to suspend the operation of the Belleville Market or any
portion thereof for specific Market days should the Market place or any portion
thereof be required for Civic purposes. In the event of such suspension, two weeks'
notice shall be given to the Lessee so affected and the Lessee shall not be entitled
to any refund of the rental for the lease.

2. The City reserves the right to cancel this lease if the Lessee fails to comply with the
terms of this By-Law as amended from time to time. In the event of such
cancellation, the Lessee shall not be entitled to any refund of the rental for the
lease.

3. Any Lessee who wishes to cancel their lease may do so at any time during the term
of the lease but shall not be entitled to any refund of the rental for the lease.

4. The leased space(s) may only be occupied during Market hours on Market days

and for Market purposes, in accordance with the terms set out in this By-Law, as
amended from time to time.

THIS LEASE IS SUBJECT TO THE PROVISIONS OF THIS BY-LAW AND
AMENDMENTS THERETO.

AND WHEREAS it is now deemed necessary and expedient that By-Law Number
14187 be amended;

NOW, THEREFORE, THE COUNCIL OF THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY OF

1. THAT, Definitions, Section 2, be amended to include the following.

"2. (d) ‘Niagara tender fruit' means peaches, plums,
nectarines, apricots, pears, grapes and sweet and

sour cherries, grown in the Niagara area of
Ontario."

2. THAT, Section 8 of By-Law Number 14187 be amended by adding the following.

THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY OF BELLEVILLE
BY-LAW NUMBER 2000-88

A BY-LAW TO AMEND BY-LAW NUMBER 14187 BEING A BY-LAW TO PROVIDE
FOR ESTABLISHING, MAINTAINING AND REGULATING A PUBLIC MARKET
PLACE ON THE MARKET SQUARE IN THE CITY OF BELLEVILLE

WHEREAS By-Law Number 14187 was duly passed by the Council of The Corporation
of the City of Belleville on the 23rd day of June, 1997;

AND WHEREAS it is now deemed necessary and expedient that By-Law Number
14187 be amended;

NOW, THEREFORE, THE COUNCIL OF THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY OF
BELLEVILLE ENACTS AS FOLLOWS:

1. THAT, Products, Section 4, be amended to include the following:

"4. The dispensing and sales, at the Market from a handcart or other form
of conveyance, of cooked and/or processed food products that can be
reheated, if necessary, shall be permitted on the Market Square. All
products shall be government inspected and must meet the Belleville
Farmers’ Market By-Laws for Ontario produced products."

THIS BY-LAW SHALL COME INTO FORCE AND TAKE EFFECT IMMEDIATELY ON:
AND AFTER THE PASSING THEREOR.
